lexUnit.name: copse.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a small group of trees.

sentence.text: The horses took clumps of gorse and two stone walls in their stride ; they ripped through a copse .
Shots were returned , but the gunmen escaped to a nearby copse .
He could grow hedges and wildflowers instead of sugar beet ; he could turn his fields into areas of ` quiet countryside enjoyment " ; he could restore ancient coppices and chalk grassland .
Tall firs form a copse at the back of the house and great clumps of rhododendrons and laurels surround the lawns to the south , conserving the safe , dark Victorian atmosphere of the place .
Somewhere distant , faint , off to my right , I can hear a cuckoo calling as he moves among the coppices and hedgerows .
Now it is free , and very agreeable it was on a spring morning to walk through its coppices and gardens of oak and maple , white roses and birches and every kind of shrub .
Two thousand acres of coppices were to be enclosed and planted with oak and beech , and a ` rolling programme " of further enclosures was projected as the trees matured .
Morgan felt more comfortable as he approached the Grange , still hidden by a copse of trees .
They passed the copse and the lights of a large Elizabethan house came into view .
Coppices of oak were cultivated in the area for the provision of charcoal .
Even the substantially open areas of the Downs hold pairs where small copses provide nest sites .
He wanders lonely valleys and isolated copses , where he plays enticing music on his flute .
Another time he passed a copse of exposed trees that had been battered by the prevailing wind for so long that the trees were permanently bent over .
He was approaching the copse of trees , a dark island by the side of the road .
How many rabbits were concealed in the copse and watching them now ?
In the early evening Hazel sought out Bigwig and together they ventured into the copse behind the warren .
A few minutes later the rabbits had crossed the cart-track and vanished into the copse beyond .
He grows roses and part of the grounds consists of a copse of mature trees .
